Get crash #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 2814 **Mekanism:** Mekanism-1.12.2-9.7.7.378 #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: (_It's almost always relevant_) https://hastebin.com/arulovaxil.sql

bug.title: Crafttweaker removeAllRecipes method of metallurgic infuser targets Chemical Crystallizer instead.
bug.body: #### Issue description: The removeAllRecipes Crafttweaker method added for the Metallurgic Infuser seems to target the Chemical Crystallizer instead. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a blank instance with Mekanism and Crafttweaker 2. Create a crafttweaker script with one line: mods.mekanism.infuser.removeAllRecipes(); 3. Launch the game 4. The Metallurgic Infuser still has its recipes; they still show in JEI and still work. The Chemical Crystallizer, however, does not. JEI shows no Crystallizer recipes and the Crystallizer accepts no gas input. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): Minecraft 1.12.2 Forge 12.23.5.2838 JEI 4.15.0.278 Mekanism 9.7.7.378 Mekanism Generators 9.7.7.378 Crafttweaker 4.1.18 Instance is otherwise blank. #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: (_It's almost always relevant_) I've never used gist before, so I hope I'm using it correctly... Debug.log: https://gist.github.com/SiliconEnt/e1ad101e306ec66287c80faf346bc3db Latest.log: https://gist.github.com/SiliconEnt/442e43c01e467680366217ccefe86a13 Crafttweaker.log: https://gist.github.com/SiliconEnt/958b592c231106dc14deda52e3406350

bug.title: Purification chamber accepts hydrogen as an input
bug.body: Hello! Just ran into an issue where I accidentally put a hydrogen tank into the Purification Chamber, and it accepted this as an input material. The Hydrogen gas is now filling the Infusion Buffer, and there's no way (that I can find, at least), to remove it.

bug.title: Metallurgic Infuser not working
bug.body: #### Issue description: Metallurgic Infuser won't begin process for any materials. I tried to make Enriched Alloy, Reinforced Alloy and a Basic Control Circuit. It takes the redstone/diamond dust and adds it to the reservoir but when i add an Iron ingot, Osmium ingot, or Enriched Alloy nothing happens. The machine does have power. This is also occurring in single player and on a server. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Place Metallurgic Infuser 2. Provide Power 3. Add infusing material 4. Add material to be infused 5. Nothing processes. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 2825 **Mekanism:** 1.12.2-9.7.4.375 **Other relevant version:** Mekanism Generators and Tools are also installed at 9.7.4.375 Screenshot: https://ibb.co/q5mFTZK Modlist: https://pastebin.com/B52KWb4J

bug.title: Robit Duplication Bug
bug.body: **Issue description:** You can duplicate items using a Robit **Steps to reproduce:** 1. Place a Chargepad in the ground 2. Put a Robit in the chargepad 3. Turn on the Follow mode & Drop Pickup mode 5. Place a stackable block that holds items in after being broken(Like Immersive Engineering Wooden Storage Crate) 6. Put some items into the Wooden Storage Crate 7. Break the Crate and let the Robit pickup it 8. Drop more empty crates for Robit 9. All the collected crates by the Robit will be the same as the first (See the video for more info) **Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting):** **Forge:** 1.12.2 - 14.23.5.2836 **Mekanism:** Mekanism-1.12.2-9.7.3.374 **If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here:** https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3y5bt98in9Y

bug.title: Digital Miner Shulker Box Duplication Bug
bug.body: **Issue description:** You can duplicate shulker boxes using a Digital Miner(It duplicates only the Shulker Box, not the items inside) **Steps to reproduce:** 1. Place a Digital Miner in the ground 2. Place a Shulker Box in the ground 3. Put any item inside the Shulker Box 5. Set a filter in the Digital Miner to mine the Shulker Box(Fuzzy Mode:ON) 6. Turn on the digital miner 7. Digital Miner will collect a Shulker Box, and at the same time, one shulker box is dropped on the ground. (See the video for more info) **Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting):** **Forge:** 1.12.2 - 14.23.5.2836 **Mekanism:** Mekanism-1.12.2-9.7.3.374 **If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here:** https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZESNiDCf_XA

bug.title: Mekanism universal cables don't give enough energy to IC2 machines
bug.body: #### Issue description: In the latest release of Mekanism, the universal cables don't give enough energy to IC2 machines. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Grab any IC2 machine (I use the electric furnace but anything works) 2. Plop in some overclockers to make it consume a bit of energy (something like 20 is enough) 3. Connect a Mekanism universal cable to power it 4. And the machine shouldn't have enough power to run continuously (like it did before 9.7.3.374) #### Versions: **Forge:** 14.23.5.2836 **Mekanism:** 9.7.3.374 **IC2:** 2.8.145-ex112 From my understanding, the problem comes from this commit https://github.com/mekanism/Mekanism/commit/b3663a37a958328156eba8b08ec4e7e19e04ebee, and this line of code https://github.com/mekanism/Mekanism/blob/faef15691ca71472a1e3732e554ea64bf30d478b/src/main/java/mekanism/common/base/EnergyAcceptorWrapper.java#L145 The simulated energy transfer isn't converted back to the proper unit and is returned as EU, changing the line to ```return fromEU(toTransfer);``` seems to fix the issue.

All the collected crafters by the miner will be the same as the first (See the video for more info) **Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting):** **Forge:** 1.12.2 - 14.23.5.2836 **Mekanism:** Mekanism-1.12.2-9.7.3.374 **If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here:** https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IKg_pf44QBo

bug.title: Metallurgic Infuser does not fill with Infusion Type after dumping
bug.body: #### Issue description: Once the dump feature is used on the metallurgic infuser, the infuser will not accept any other infusion type. Putting in anything else will just void it. Reference https://github.com/Darkosto/SkyFactory4Issues/issues/710 for the initial report. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Place infuser & put Compressed Carbon in 2. Press "Dump" 3. Attempt to put any other type in (such as Compressed Redstone) 4. See it get voided 5. Put Compressed Carbon in and see it fill #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 14.23.5.2831 **Mekanism:** 9.7.2

bug.title: Personal chest's BUG.Double the item
bug.body: Personal chest's BUG. Double the item. like this #5027. My English is not very good, please forgive me. You can also watch this video, don't know if you can open it, this video is in China. https://www.bilibili.com/video/av39131440 modpack SkyFactory4 Mekanism-1.12.2-9.7.2.373.jar in a server ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19620848/56851651-ff644f00-6943-11e9-85d0-f581076e1434.png) 1.Get two personal chests in your hotbar. 2.Open box at number 4 and press button number 3 quickly 3.When the speed is fast enough, the item in box No. 4 will be displayed, but the box No. 3 will be opened, and the item in box No. 4 will still be taken out.

bug.title: Formulaic Assemblicator consume items with transformDamage added by crafttweaker...
bug.body: #### Issue description: During somes tests, I fond a problem with the Formulaic Assemblicator or possibly 2 different problem; - First, I have add somes recipe for somes Mystical Agriculture Infusion Crystal (created by ContentTweaker) make with Crafttweaker. When I try the recipe in a regular craftting table, the crystal stay in the grid but get damage... In the Formulaic Assemblicator, the crystal is simply consume when making the first set of Essence... You can see the issue in video: https://streamable.com/x3slq And heres the crafting recipe: ``` var crystals = [ <contenttweaker:infusioncrystal_tier0:*>.transformDamage(), <contenttweaker:infusioncrystal_tier1:*>.transformDamage(), <contenttweaker:infusioncrystal_tier2:*>.transformDamage(), <contenttweaker:infusioncrystal_tier3:*>.transformDamage(), <contenttweaker:infusioncrystal_tier4:*>.transformDamage() ] as IIngredient[]; recipes.addShaped("mystical_prudentium", <mysticalagriculture:crafting:1>, [[null, <mysticalagriculture:crafting>, null], [<mysticalagriculture:crafting>, crystals[0]|crystals[1]|crystals[2]|crystals[3]|crystals[4] , <mysticalagriculture:crafting>], [null, <mysticalagriculture:crafting>, null]]); ``` - With the basic Infusion Crystal from Mystical Agriculture, the crystal should probably stay in the grid, but this one goes in the output slot after making the first craft, making the automation really annoying. Here a demonstration video: https://streamable.com/2z056 If you want to test with added recipe, you can simply copy my code and use a sword or thing like that at the place of the crystal and I think it will do the exact same issue. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a recipe with transformDamage in Crafttweaker 2. Try to craft in the Formulaic Assemblicator 3. Enjoy your item waste! #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 14.23.5.2824 **Mekanism:** 9.7.1.371 **Other relevant version:** Crafttweaker: 4.1.17 #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: There have no crash and I no logs for that. But if needed I can send you more informations or scripts from my modpack if it can help... Thank's for you amazing work, and making Mekanism great again! Your team is awesome! Long life to Mekanism!! Fireztonez

bug.title: TileEntityBasicBlock causes incompatibility
bug.body: TileEntityBasicBlock updates neighbouring blocks during the chunk loading process by calling markDirty(). This may happen before the server is running and therefore may cause errors in other mods. For example this results in XNet networks to not load correctly as described [here](https://github.com/McJtyMods/XNet/issues/283).

bug.title: Induction cells lose stored energy when used to craft higher tier cells.
bug.body: #### Issue description: When using induction cells that have already been charged as part of an induction matrix to craft an induction cell of a higher tier, the resulting induction cell is crafted as an empty cell without retaining the energy of the cells it was crafted from. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Craft basic induction cells and put them in an induction matrix to charge. 2. Remove the basic induction cells form the induction matrix and use them as crafting ingredients to craft an advanced induction cell. 3. The advanced induction cell will be crafted with no energy stored at all. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 14.23.4.2707 **Mekanism:** 1.12.2-9.4.11.346

bug.title: Mekanism Versioning
bug.body: #### Issue description: Mekanism versioning isn't good if somebody want to use it for dependencies because prefixing the Minecraft version is bad. Forge allows to be define a minium version of a mod as requiring, for example: ``` @Mod(modid = SodiumCraft.MODID, version = SodiumCraft.VERSION, dependencies="required-after:mekanism@[9.4,);required-after:thermalexpansion@[5.3,)") ``` On Mekanism, we should now require defining something like ``` dependencies="required-after:mekanism@[1.12.2-9.4,)") ``` But If I support multiple Minecraft version like 1.11 and 1.12 or some minor versions, e.g. its nearly impossible to use a constant minimum-version. Other Mods like ThermalExpansion do not use mc verson as prefix, too. ``` $ unzip -q -c Mekanism-1.12.2-9.4.3.330.jar mcmod.info | grep '"version"' "version": "1.12.2-9.4.3.330", $ unzip -q -c ThermalExpansion-1.12.2-5.3.7.31-universal.jar mcmod.info | grep '"version"' "version": "5.3.7.31", ```

bug.body: Is this an intentional design decision or an omission?

bug.title: [1.12] Electrolytic Separator + Energy Upgrades = Hydrogen Power
bug.body: #### Issue description: The Electrolytic Separator accepts Energy Upgrades. In the past, this only increased the energy capacity. The Electrolytic Separator was the only machine to not receive a boost in efficiency in order to prevent an infinite energy loop using Hydrogen Gas. The Electrolytic Separator currently does get the energy boost and can produce an infinite energy loop using Hydrogen Gas. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Stick a full set of Energy Upgrades in the Electrolytic Separator. 2. Supply Water 3. Burn Hydrogen in a Gas-Burning Generator for 10x the power you put in. A full set of Speed Upgrades will net you nearly 18k J/t. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge: 14.23.1.2561** **Mekanism: 9.4.2.327** Test pack included Mek Generators and Tools, and JEI 4.8.5.134. No other mods.

bug.title: Digital Miner does nothing when Silk Touch is activated
bug.body: #### Issue description: When activating the silk touch Feature in the digital miner, the digital miner just stops working, even though "All well" is shown. The ore Counts no longer down and no ore is delivered. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 2513 **Mekanism:** 9.4.1.326 I don't know if this is a bug, or has any other reason, as i never used Silk Touch in the miner before. There is enough electricity, as the digital miner is fed by a creative engine, as i'm atm using it to check if my worldgen is as i want it.

bug.title: Fluid Glitch With Stacked Tanks
bug.body: #### Issue description: If tanks are crafted (shift click) and they stack, when collecting a fluid in bucket mod, ALL tanks in the stack get that amount of fluid. So a stack of 16 tanks would automatically get 1 bucket in each rather than splitting off a tank and filling that tank only #### Steps to reproduce: 1. mass craft 16 fluid tanks at once so MC makes them stack (when they have no "owner) 2. collect a fluid in bucket mode with the whole stack #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 1.12 (*.2512) **Mekanism:** 9.4.1.326

bug.title: Condensentrator arrows are wrong in JEI when showing multiple recipes
bug.body: #### Issue description: When viewing recipes for the rotary condensentrator with JEI, all arrows on each page will point the same way, even if some of the recipes are condensentrating and some are decondensentrating. (This bug does not occur if only one recipe per page is visible.) #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Right-click a rotary condensentrator 2. Click the arrow with tooltip "Show Recipes" 3. Make sure your screen is big enough, or your GUI size small enough, to see at least two recipes per page #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 14.23.0.2503 **Mekanism:** 9.4.1.326 **Other relevant version:** JEI 4.8.0.105 ![2017-10-07_11 32 56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16061266/31309435-12d5ee54-ab54-11e7-83eb-0127eaca0353.png)

bug.title: [1.12] Bin crafting item duplication
bug.body: #### Issue description: Items could be duplicated when adding items to a bin in a crafting table due to bin stacking. Temporary workaround (disable stacking of it) in the commit which is referenced below (don't know the SHA of it yet) #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Place a single (empty) bin in the middle of a crafting table 2. Add a stack of a random item to any other slot 3. See the correct output appear, with on the tooltip the right amount of items 4. DO NOT CRAFT YET! 5. Add another 63 empty bins to the bin already in the crafting table, do not pick it out 6. Check that the output hasn't changed 7. "Craft" one filled bin 8. Check the crafting grid, it now contains 126 bins and a stack of 126 items. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 14.22.0.2446 **Mekanism:** SHA: 03016ddd62665b7ea5a44ff86897bfc048b9501d **Other relevant version:** Using develop environment, with all the there present mods. #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: (_It's almost always relevant_) No crash log, confirmed there are no other log rules appearing.

Unfortunately, when standing on a charger with a discharged Configurator, it is not charged. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Check why the rear Chargepad connector does not have power. 2. bug.title: [1.10.2] Portable Teleporter Stopped Teleporting
bug.body: #### Issue description: Just recently, I have become unable to teleport using the Portable teleporter. I initially thought it was something to do with the item, so I threw it away and spawned in a new (charged) one. I've also tried removing the teleporter block and replacing it with a new one. When I try to teleport to any of my private frequencies, the purple particles appear as usual, but then the particles just keep spawning, and I never get teleported. I tried teleporting with a teleporter frame, and it works instantly, so the issue is only with the portable teleporter. I am not sure what changed between it working and not working. I know that a couple of times before, this happened, and a simple rejoin fixed it. This time, rejoining and restarting the server has not resolved the issue. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Use portable teleporter 2. Select frequency 3. Press teleport 4. Particles appear 5. Wait for teleport 6. Keep waiting 7. Never teleport #### Version: **Forge: 12.18.3.2422** **Mekanism: 9.2.3** #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: (_It's almost always relevant_) Both the server log and client log have zero errors/warnings/notices as it doesn't output anything when the issue happens, so I'm afraid this might be hard to track down. Edit: I'll upload both the server and client logs when I get them anyway.

bug.title: Robit inventory dupe
bug.body: *Please use the search functionality before reporting an issue. Also take a look at the closed issues!* I checked, this specific case didn't seem to be mentioned yet. #### Issue description: When you open the Robit GUI and click on its inventory icon with an item in hand, that item will get duped. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Open the Robit GUI. Don't go anywhere specific yet. 2. From your own inventory, select an item you wanted to dump in the Robit's inventory. 3. With that item selected, click on the Robit's inventory icon. 4. You'll drop that item (which you can pick up again). 5. Quit the GUI, reopen it, go to its inventory normally, and you'll also see the item there. It's duped at this point. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** forge-1.12.1-14.22.1.2485-universal **Mekanism:** 1.12.1-9.4.1.326 **Other relevant version:** Using All The Mods 3 v3.3

bug.title: [1.11.2] Logistical Sorter item filtering issue
bug.body: #### Issue description: Using the logistical sorter to sort the drops from a mob farm and I've run into an issue when trying to send items like bows ect which are damaged to a different location it will only filter the exact bow that was used to create the filter because it's using the metadata from that item. With a bow filter in place it will send the bow or those with identical metadata to the correct storage but at the same time it also wont send the other bows to the other storage which is currently set to take everything not filtered so the bows will just sit in the original storage. I found a similar issue from 2014 where a subtype check was added but this doesn't seem to be an option in the logistical sorter anymore. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Place storage. 2. Place logistical sorter pulling from the storage. 3. Place logistical transporters connecting the sorter to two more storage and paint the transporters different colours. 4. Set the sorters default filter to 1 of the colours then create a filter for bows set to the 2nd colour. 5. Add some random items and bows with different metadata to the first storage. 6. The random items will now be in the 2nd storage and any bows with the same metadata as the original will be in the 3rd storage all the remaining bows will still be in the first storage. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 13.20.1.2454 **Mekanism:** 9.3.4 **Other relevant version:**

bug.title: Mekanism cable networks are breaking when leaving an area and re-entering it.
bug.body: # Note from dev: Please do _not_ add a 'me too' to this issue. If you wish to subscribe for updates, use the button in the sidebar. It is a known issue that we have not figured out. Of course it's going to affect you. ------------------------------------------------------------------------ #### Issue description: Mekanism cable networks cease to exist when leaving an area and coming back, chunk-loaded or not. Breaking one of the cables doesn't work as it doesn't transmit power to the adjacent cables. I have to break all of them to have a complete network again. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Place mekanism cables to form a cable network. 2. Leave the area they are in (at least 32 chunks away). 3. Coming back, the cables will have ceased working and the network will no longer be existent. You will have to replace all cables for it to function again. **Forge:** 2460 **Mekanism:** 9.4.1 **Other relevant version:** The crashlog here is ***NOT*** relevant in any way, I'm just posting it so you can see the modlist (the mods haven't changed but they have been updated recently to their latest versions with no impact on this bug whatsoever). https://gist.github.com/Xerasin/3a52eae8f6d920eb97510f08eeb0bb05

But Injection rate 12 only gives me 276830 rf/t now and it wont run at all at injection rates 2 or 4 (didnt try the others i went from 4 to 12 in my tests) Currently im running Mekanism-1.12.1-9.4.0.318. But i've had this problem before in a pre 1.0 forge version. Ps. Both Deutirium and Trtium supplys are running stable so i dont have a lack of fuel. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. 2. 3. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge: forge-1.12.1-14.22.0.2456 **Mekanism: 1.12.1-9.4.0.318 **Other relevant version:** #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: (_It's almost always relevant_) Game didn't crash only weird rector behaviour.

bug.title: [1.11.2] Mekanism item pipes incompatible with Storage Drawers
bug.body: #### Issue description: Mekanism item pipes and machines do not recognize Storage Drawers; they will not output to or retrieve from any storage drawers. Many other modded item pipes work with Storage Drawers just fine, but I don't want to need other mods besides Mekanism just for pipes. Storage Drawers are cheaper to make, less lag/fps issues, and more configurable than Bins; otherwise I'd use those instead. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Place a storage drawer. 2. Place a Mekanism machine or item pipe next to that storage drawer and try to configure it to output to or draw from that drawer. 3. Nothing happens, pipes won't even show a connection. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 1.11.2 - 13.20.1.2454 **Mekanism:** 1.11.2 - 9.3.4-fix **Other relevant version:** Storage Drawers 1.11.2 - 4.2.10 #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: (_It's almost always relevant_) No crash, just doesn't work.

bug.title: flamethrower not aiming correctly
bug.body: #### Issue description: i've been playing on a pack called modern skyblock 2. it's a fun skyblock pack that has mekanism. i made a flamethrower for fun, and tried using it a little. charged it up, and, tried to smelt something below me. and then it didn't work. tried a few times, and then realised that it's not firing where i'm aiming. used f5, and noticed something weird. when i look forward in a 90 degree angle, it fires right. if i move it x degrees up/down, it will fire x degrees up. then i tried firing around me, and noticed it always fires in relatively the same direction. i was able to spin it a bit to the left or right, but it always fired there, even when i looked the other way. so i checked which direction it is. apparently, i couldn't fire anywhere that isn't in the arc between south to east. when the flames hit something they do act correctly, so this is only an issue with how it aims. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. make flamethrower 2. charge it 3. fire it #### Version: **Forge: 14.22.0.2459** **Mekanism: 1.12.1-9.4.0.318** **Other relevant version: minecraft 1.11.2, modern skyblock 2 version 2.3.5**

bug.title: [1.12] Personal Chest, Saw Mill, Creative Energy Cube Issues
bug.body: Issue description: 1. Unsure if this has always been like this, but seems odd: Personal Chest only allows right-clicking 2. Precision Saw Mill does not contain recipes for any wood log variants (planks seem to work) and will not process normal wood logs, including any wood (planks are fine; does not touch fences/doors/other wooden items from other mods but idk if that's always been the case) from mods like BOP & Forestry. 3. bug.title: [1.11.2] Energy side configuration doesn't respect block orientation
bug.body: #### Issue description: Regardless of which way a block is oriented the side configuration for energy always treats the faces as follows: - Front is North - Back is South - Left is West - Right is East - Bottom is Down - Top is Up Also tested with items but this seems to be functioning as expected. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Face north 2. Place an energy cube / machine / quantum entangloporter 3. Configure the block to accept energy on every side 3. Surround the block with universal energy cables 4. Toggle the energy acceptance for each side on/off and make note of which cables detach 5. Repeat the process facing South, East, West, Up, Down as desired #### Version: **Forge:** 13.20.1.2393 **Mekanism:** 9.3.3.311-fix

bug.title: Thermal Evaporation Plant Issue
bug.body: *Please use the search functionality before reporting an issue. Also take a look at the closed issues!* #### Issue description: I am having an issue with the Thermal evaporation plant in the mod. Since the game updates every block that is part of the plant when it (the game) starts up, it is causing a huge, and i mean huge, lag spike. Since i put 2 next to each other in the ore processing facility that i was building, and my game crashed (Because i was adding some levels to the TEP) when i was right beside them, now everytime i try to enter the world i was in, the game lags so hard that it crashes without letting me move an inch. Is there a way i can solve this or deactivate the TEP temporarily so i can move all that stuff to other chunk? I'm worried because the only thing left to try is to take out the whole mod from the game and that would destroy at least an 80% percent of the things i have built already. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Setup two thermal evaporation plants, with a height of 14 blocks 2. Destroy the thermal evaporation controller and add extra levels (5 in my case) 3. Place the thermal evaporation controllers again #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** **Mekanism:** **Other relevant version:** #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: (_It's almost always relevant_) [gist/pastebin/etc link here]

bug.title: [1.11.2] Server Crash

A few days ago, our official pack server started crashing whenever someone is near a Mekanism machine (tested with a Metallurgic Infuser and Enrichment Chamber). At first we thought that it was all due to Mekanism, but today we figured out that it doesn't happen when the crafting recipes in JEI bug out, as it sometimes happens with the 1.11.2 version. Then we tried changing the JEI version on the client back to the version where all was fine, but it didn't help. Either way, by the crash log we can tell that it has something to do with Mekanism. #### Version (make sure you are on the latest version before reporting): **Forge:** 13.20.0.2315 **Mekanism:** 9.3.2.307 **JEI (if it actually has to do with it)** 4.5.0.289 #### If a (crash)log is relevant for this issue, link it here: (_It's almost always relevant_) https://paste.ee/p/a1wzk

bug.title: [1.11.2] Logistical Transporters try to insert items into bins from bottom (and fail)
bug.body: Hey there, I have been building a room with bins as a storage room, connected with logistical transporters to an input-chest. See picture below for setup :D The lower bins have their inputs connected from the top (as it should be), the upper bins have been disconnected from the logistical transporters that lead to the lower bins with the configurator (set to "NONE") as they are not supposed to output any items via pipe. For the upper bins there is another pipe, leading alongside the top sides of those bins (as intended). The bug now is, that the pipe tries to fill the bins from the bottom and fail. The bins won't accept items from that side but the pipe is stubborn and tries endless. New items that are sent into the system, will also go the wrong way. For the bins in the bottom row everything works fine. Is it a bug in the pipe-system or in the bins? Disassembling the corresponding piece of pipe results in itemloss. I've lost 1000 redstones that way because i thought it'd drop into my face when disassembling the buggy piece of pipe. I could of course add a block in between the upper bins and the pipe for the lower bins to achieve the upper ones not beeing connected to the lower bins' pipes, but the setup I've built worked in older versions, so it should still do? The chest you can see at the end of the setup normally is not there. Build it for debugging attempts. It does not affect the outcome, still happens without the chest attached. Kind regards pflonk Mekanism-1.11.2-9.3.1.306 forge1.11.2-13.20.0.2312 ![2017-06-05_15 05 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/29201706/26784978/89d5fce8-4a00-11e7-97fd-0b0782cb90b3.png)

bug.title: Inconsistency with Factory power consumption
bug.body: Hi, As I can see in the source code (and have verified this in a quick game test), the factory blocks all have a flat energy consumption of 50 * numberOfProcessingQueues (e,g 50 * 3 for Basic Factory). This makes sense for the basic machines like the Smelter and Crusher, but for machines like the Chemical Injection Chamber which consume much more than the basic machines, this one-for-all formula introduces balancing issues. Consider replacing the config option of "FactoryUsage" with a consumption *multiplier* instead? Perhaps with a default value of 1.0 - meaning that each queue of a Factory consumes 1.0 * the original energy consumption. So the basic machine factories would still be the same, but the advanced ones would scale to their original energy rates appropriately. I've noticed you haven't done any activity on 1.7.10 for a while, which is what we're using. If you like this idea but aren't interested in updating old Mekanism, can I fork it and make the change for our modpack - sending a PR back when done? Cheers

bug.title: [1.10.2] Digital Miner with Anchor Upgrade does not keep dimension loaded
bug.body: I put an anchor upgrade into a digital miner and left it in an RFtools dimension. As soon as I teleported out of the dimension, I took a look at the ender chest it was dumping into, and I saw a few ores, then the ores stopped, then the server console showed the lines indicating the dimension had unloaded. I expected the miner to do the necessary to keep the chunk(s) it is mining chunkloaded, and keep the dimension it is in loaded as well.

bug.title: Max size Induction Matrix (18x18x18) Causes Server Lag
bug.body: This isn't the first Mekanism multiblock to cause server lag. We've previously taken down all the salination towers for a similar reason, but the extent that the Induction Matrix causes lag is far, far greater. `TPS: 14.1 Single Entity | Time/Tick | % TileEntityInductionPort {2792,59,5431}:0 | 2.036 | 4.927 TileCustomCable {2793,76,5446}:0 | 1.010 | 2.445 TileCustomCable {2793,76,5433}:0 | 0.996 | 2.411 TileEntityInductionPort {2808,59,5432}:0 | 0.976 | 2.361 TileEntityInductionPort {2807,74,5448}:0 | 0.975 | 2.359 Chunk | Time/Tick | % 0: 174, 339 | 6.168 | 15.034 0: 174, 340 | 5.074 | 12.367 0: 175, 339 | 4.070 | 9.920 0: 175, 340 | 4.044 | 9.856 0: 0, 9 | 0.805 | 1.961 All Entities of Type | Time/Tick | % TileEntityInductionPort | 16.361 | 39.878 TileCustomCable | 2.092 | 5.098 TileConduitBundle | 1.654 | 4.032 TileMultipartContainer$Ticking | 1.321 | 3.220 monster.EntityWitch | 1.001 | 2.439 Average Entity of Type | Time/tick | Calls TileEntityInductionPort | 0.824 | 2800 TileEntityWeatherStation | 0.116 | 88 tile.TileController | 0.088 | 987 EntityButterfly | 0.070 | 141 TileExternalStorage | 0.067 | 705` The difference between having that thing loaded or not is night and day. Since the lag seems to be concentrated at the induction ports, look to the code that adds energy and see what an 18x18x18 matrix filled with Ultimate cells does. I think you'll find a serious inefficiency there. This is with the latestâ€”as of todayâ€”version. The Avant 3 pack got it's 1.16 update JUST to make sure this hadn't been fixed.

bug.title: Logistical transporter - some items won't cross chunk boundary
bug.body: Just ran into a very odd issue: had a vanilla chest that was getting Sulfur Ore (Railcraft) and Iron Ore inserted into it from another mod (Immersive Engineering Excavator, but that isn't relevent: I replicated it without IE stuff anywhere near). Connected the chest to an Entangloporter via a Basic Logistical Transporter and configured the chest end to pull, and found that it was pulling the Sulfur and dirt out of the chest, but would not pull Iron Ore or grassy dirt. I checked the destination, and there was plenty of room in the output inventory. If the last item in the input chest was grassy dirt or Iron Ore, it wouldn't pull anything into the Entangloporter. I tried removing and replacing all components several times, and made sure nothing was colour-coded with the configurator, but no joy. I've used the same setup dozens of times with no problems, so it took me a while to spot what I'd done differently: the chest and the Entangloporter were separated by a chunk boundary. Both chunks were chunkloaded, but moving the entangloporter to the same chunk caused the pipe to start dragging out everything properly.

Mean TPS: 0.286 [09:27:28] [Server thread/INFO]: Overall : Mean tick time: 3517.201 ms. bug.title: [1.10.2, bug, breaking] machine denies to let any item enter through a tube (only at a given coordinate, restart solves temporarily)
bug.body: all other possibilities (other tubes, machines, configurations and rotations) didn't change it. Only moving the machine into an adjacent block and doing some rewiring worked. Moving the machine back to it's original place made it stop accepting items again. Server restart solved the problem temporarily. Guess: Chunkloading issues

bug.title: [1.10.2] multiblock doesn't share information across the chunk borders
bug.body: we have an induction matrix that stands in 4 different chunks (unintentionally). If one clicks on a block you only get the information about in/output that occurs in the same chunk. So if you have an input in chunk X and an output in chunk Y you and click on a block in chunk Z, you won't get any information at all, if you click on a block that is in chunk X you'll only get the input and for Y you'll only get the output. Edit: A server restart solved the problem temporarily. Guess: chunkloading problems

bug.title: [bug] Jetpack somehow resets consumed hydrogen regularly
bug.body: (1.10.2) Situation: Ascending in regular mode. 2 Ways: a) switch to hover mode while keeping space pressed. The used hydrogen since the beginning of the "flight" is being restored. b) stop holding space and once you have some nice falling speed press and hold space again. You're slowing the fall and the used hydrogen is restored aswell

bug.title: FPS Tanked w/ Logistics Pipes + Mek Bins
bug.body: Suffering major FPS drops [like 90%+ drops] when using ultimate logistical transporters + Mekanism bins. Not sure if it is flooding rendering updates or what but it is only with the bins as the logistics pipes by themselves don't cause it even when transferring insane amounts of items to say... 10 overclocked recyclers. Ran into something like this with Pressure Pipes tanks when using the tank indicator and bdew tracked the problem to his rendering update code firing waaaay too much as the tank indicator was constantly changing as the tank filled and I believe he said something about "complex models" being within a 16x16x16 range around the tank indicator, ie models that have rendering updates often/constantly if that helps. I don't have this issue using Storage Drawers or any other storage systems. Mekanism 9.1.1 MC 1.10.2 Forge 2065 Thanks

bug.title: Industrial Turbine UI inconsistency
bug.body: Sometime the turbine UI will show me the total steam flow rate and power generation, other times it will divide that by the number of ports. Example: I have a reactor running at injection 20, generating ~750B of steam into a turbine with 2 ports. When I first built the turbine, it reported flow of 749488 mB/t and production of 23.55 MRF. If I quit and restart Minecraft, those numbers will change to 385339 mB/t and 12.11 MRF. It's still outputting 23.55 MRF, it just shows the wrong number in the UI. Breaking and reforming the turbine causes the correct number to appear. Mekanism 9.0.2.271

bug.title: Crash with teleporter at lowest level
bug.body: When placing a Teleporter block at the lowest level possible in the End, the client crashes. When doing this on a server the server does not crash, but as soon as the affected client rejoins they crash as the block is placed successfully. This does not happen if the Teleporter is placed one block above the lowest level. Found using Lapito's Galacticraft mod pack, Minecraft 1.6.4, using Mekanism 6.0.5.46 ``` java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1 at net.minecraft.world.chunk.Chunk.func_76610_a(Chunk.java:640) at net.minecraft.world.chunk.Chunk.func_76597_e(Chunk.java:981) at net.minecraft.world.ChunkCache.func_72796_p(ChunkCache.java:115) at mekanism.common.block.BlockMachine.getLightValue(BlockMachine.java:302) at net.minecraft.block.Block.func_71874_e(Block.java:519) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.RenderBlocks.func_78578_a(RenderBlocks.java:4271) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.RenderBlocks.func_78570_q(RenderBlocks.java:4174) at mekanism.client.render.block.MachineRenderingHandler.renderWorldBlock(MachineRenderingHandler.java:172) at cpw.mods.fml.client.registry.RenderingRegistry.renderWorldBlock(RenderingRegistry.java:152) at FMLRenderAccessLibrary.renderWorldBlock(FMLRenderAccessLibrary.java:57) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.RenderBlocks.func_78612_b(RenderBlocks.java:485) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.WorldRenderer.func_78907_a(WorldRenderer.java:224) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.RenderGlobal.func_72716_a(RenderGlobal.java:1551) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.EntityRenderer.func_78471_a(EntityRenderer.java:1129) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.EntityRenderer.func_78480_b(EntityRenderer.java:1006) at net.minecraft.client.Minecraft.func_71411_J(Minecraft.java:946) at net.minecraft.client.Minecraft.func_99999_d(Minecraft.java:838) at net.minecraft.client.main.Main.main(SourceFile:101) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at net.minecraft.launchwrapper.Launch.launch(Launch.java:131) at net.minecraft.launchwrapper.Launch.main(Launch.java:27) ``` ## A detailed walkthrough of the error, its code path and all known details is as follows: -- Head -- ``` Stacktrace: at net.minecraft.world.chunk.Chunk.func_76610_a(Chunk.java:640) at net.minecraft.world.chunk.Chunk.func_76597_e(Chunk.java:981) at net.minecraft.world.ChunkCache.func_72796_p(ChunkCache.java:115) at mekanism.common.block.BlockMachine.getLightValue(BlockMachine.java:302) at net.minecraft.block.Block.func_71874_e(Block.java:519) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.RenderBlocks.func_78578_a(RenderBlocks.java:4271) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.RenderBlocks.func_78570_q(RenderBlocks.java:4174) at mekanism.client.render.block.MachineRenderingHandler.renderWorldBlock(MachineRenderingHandler.java:172) at cpw.mods.fml.client.registry.RenderingRegistry.renderWorldBlock(RenderingRegistry.java:152) at FMLRenderAccessLibrary.renderWorldBlock(FMLRenderAccessLibrary.java:57) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.RenderBlocks.func_78612_b(RenderBlocks.java:485) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.WorldRenderer.func_78907_a(WorldRenderer.java:224) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.RenderGlobal.func_72716_a(RenderGlobal.java:1551) at net.minecraft.client.renderer.EntityRenderer.func_78471_a(EntityRenderer.java:1129) ``` -- Affected level -- ``` Details: Level name: MpServer All players: 1 total; [GCCorePlayerSP['lprob1'/370, l='MpServer', x=56.02, y=2.23, z=12.19]] Chunk stats: MultiplayerChunkCache: 441 Level seed: 0 Level generator: ID 00 - default, ver 1. bug.title: Machines cause unnecessary chunk updates
bug.body: As in the title: transferring gas to the tank and / or from it leads to huge fps drop. Tested with Mekanism-1.7.10-7.1.1.118.jar

bug.title: Purification Chamber doesn't consume Oxygen
bug.body: https://github.com/BevoTechPack/BevoTechPack/issues/588 Mekanism-1.7.10-7.1.1.105.jar If you insert a gas tank with oxygen in a puri chamber it takes the 200 oxygen to fill the buffer and then consumes no more even when processing ores. This is with and without speed/energy upgrades. Also does the same with Electro Sep.

bug.title: Teleporter Bugs!
bug.body: - Entities are not teleported. - Incorrect amount of energy is used. - Crashes when teleporting from lowest level in the End,

bug.title: Right click on materials into machinery
bug.body: While in the enrichment chamber, sometimes if you right-click on your inventory, it won't visually head into the dark blue slot to be processed but it actually is there processing. This might also happen with the energized smelter. I'm running 1.7.10 build 1200 NEI latest version Inventory Tweeks

bug.title: Mekanism Power causing crash with Applied Energistics 2
bug.body: Hi, I've encountered an issue with Mek power and AE2 ME Networks systems. Below is the crash report. Happens in SP and multiplayer. Forge 1191 AE2 rv0-stable-10 Mek 7.0.0.87 Game doesn't crash per-say but freezes (no actual crash report). In multiplayer the server goes into overload (200+% CPU) and no crash log is generated. FYI I'm still getting that weird bug with MEK items placed by other players showing up as incorrect tiles. Will record it and upload it to youtube to show you. I hope the below helps. If not please let me know where to look as I can reproduce the issue very quickly. in short this is what the AE2 guys said was the problem: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: readerIndex(18) + length(4) exceeds writerIndex(18): UnpooledHeapByteBuf(ridx: 18, widx: 18, cap: 18/35) at io.netty.buffer.AbstractByteBuf.checkReadableBytes(AbstractByteBuf.java:1160) at io.netty.buffer.AbstractByteBuf.readInt(AbstractByteBuf.java:611) at mekanism.generators.common.tile.TileEntityHeatGenerator.handlePacketData(TileEntityHeatGenerator.java:240) full report below. --- net.minecraft.inventory.ISidedInventory [07:52:10] [Client thread/ERROR] [ForgeMultipart]: Trait already registered for net.minecraft.inventory.ISidedInventory [07:52:10] [Client thread/ERROR] [ForgeMultipart]: Trait already registered for buildcraft.api.power.IPowerReceptor [07:52:10] [Client thread/ERROR] [ForgeMultipart]: Trait already registered for buildcraft.api.power.IPowerReceptor [07:52:10] [Client thread/ERROR] [ForgeMultipart]: Trait already registered for net.minecraftforge.fluids.IFluidHandler [07:52:10] [Client thread/ERROR] [ForgeMultipart]: Trait already registered for net.minecraftforge.fluids.IFluidHandler [AirInspector] appeng.tile.networking.TileCableBus.cleanup() [07:52:10] [Client thread/INFO] [AE2:C]: Layer: appeng/parts/layers/LayerISidedInventory_TileCableBus loaded successfully - 5530 bytes [07:52:10] [Client thread/INFO] [AE2:C]: Layer: appeng/parts/layers/LayerIFluidHandler_TileCableBus loaded successfully - 2441 bytes [07:52:10] [Client thread/INFO] [AE2:C]: Layer: appeng/parts/layers/LayerITileStorageMonitorable_TileCableBus loaded successfully - bug.title: The evil TileEntity cast crash bug
bug.body: When I attempted to right click on a Mekanism machine (I think it was electrolytic separator) with a block in my hand (I believe it was clear glass from tinker's constructs) in my single player world, the client crashed to desktop. Upon reload, my world no longer appeared in the select world list, and several attempt to recover it have failed. The world still appears in the "saves" folder however. All the files, region data, etc are still there as well. The only thing that seems to be missing is level.dat, a rather important file. copying and renaming "level.dat_mcr" to "level.dat" in an attempt to get minecraft to ask me to update to anvil format didn't work. This is a major issue if a silly mistake like that can make your world unplayable. For reference I'm playing on the most recent public version of the CrackPack through the ATLauncher. I've reported the issue there as well: github.com/sciguyryan/TheCrackPack/issues/41#issuecomment-44373747 pastebin to crash report: http://pastebin.com/hvjJrdwQ Here's the top section of the crash report for convenience: ---- Minecraft Crash Report ---- // I'm sorry, Dave. Time: 5/27/14 11:56 PM Description: Ticking memory connection java.lang.ClassCastException: mekanism.common.tile.TileEntityRotaryCondensentrator cannot be cast to mekanism.common.tile.TileEntityElectrolyticSeparator at mekanism.common.CommonProxy.getServerGui(CommonProxy.java:382) at mekanism.common.CoreGuiHandler.getServerGuiElement(CoreGuiHandler.java:18) at cpw.mods.fml.common.network.NetworkRegistry.openRemoteGui(NetworkRegistry.java:308) at cpw.mods.fml.common.network.FMLNetworkHandler.openGui(FMLNetworkHandler.java:353) at net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer.openGui(EntityPlayer.java:2480) at mekanism.common.block.BlockMachine.func_71903_a(BlockMachine.java:714) at net.minecraft.item.ItemInWorldManager.func_73078_a(ItemInWorldManager.java:421) at net.minecraft.network.NetServerHandler.func_72472_a(NetServerHandler.java:556) at net.minecraft.network.packet.Packet15Place.func_73279_a(SourceFile:58) at net.minecraft.network.MemoryConnection.func_74428_b(MemoryConnection.java:89) at net.minecraft.network.NetServerHandler.func_72570_d(NetServerHandler.java:141) at net.minecraft.network.NetworkListenThread.func_71747_b(NetworkListenThread.java:54) at net.minecraft.server.integrated.IntegratedServerListenThread.func_71747_b(IntegratedServerListenThread.java:109) at net.minecraft.server.MinecraftServer.func_71190_q(MinecraftServer.java:691) at net.minecraft.server.MinecraftServer.func_71217_p(MinecraftServer.java:587) at net.minecraft.server.integrated.IntegratedServer.func_71217_p(IntegratedServer.java:129) at net.minecraft.server.MinecraftServer.run(MinecraftServer.java:484) at net.minecraft.server.ThreadMinecraftServer.run(SourceFile:583)

bug.title: (BUG - Induction Wires) Super charged free power from RF to Energy Cubes.
bug.body: MC 1.6.4 Forge 953 Mekanism 592 Thermal Expansion 3.0.0.8a (or something) Big Reactors 2.4a So I have tested this with Mekanism power generators as well as Thermal Expansion Generators and Big Reactors. The problem consistently occurs when converting power from Redstone Flux to Joules/Mega-Joules over Mekanism Induction wires. I have checked this with Universal Cable, no problem there... behaves normally. Here's the setup: ![2013-12-04_22 13 43](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4295188/1679995/c524ebe2-5d64-11e3-8463-d0faf6d64ead.png) Real simple setup. Two seperate Ultimate Energy Cubes, both completely empty. The one on the left is hooked up to a Redstone Energy Cell via Universal Cable. The one on the right is hooked up to the same size cell (both 100% full), but using Silver Induction Cable instead of Universal Cable. The moment I put the RF Energy Cell on the left down,it starts charging the left Ultimate Energy Cube at a steady pace. (The below screenshot represents the RF Energy Cell once the Ultimate Energy Cube was at 10 MJ capacity out of 128 max.) ![2013-12-04_22 15 55](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4295188/1680006/1eecb3d0-5d65-11e3-93fa-b8952311c20b.png) The instant I put down the RF Energy Cell on the right... it shoots to max power of 128 MJ _INSTANTLY_ while the RF Energy Cell only expends perhaps 5% power. ![2013-12-04_22 15 57](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4295188/1680011/364c3fbe-5d65-11e3-9d45-bf30697e69df.png) This above picture shows the level of power in the RF Energy Cell on the right, AFTER the "instant super charge" has been given to the Ultimate Energy Cube that has charged it to max power of 128 MJ within the span of a half second. (Seriously.) Power is also consistently maintained going through the Ultimate Energy Cube the entire time, keeping it at a constant 127.8 MJ of power despite my running several factorie and two Digital Miners off it that had been fully tricked out. So this is not just an 'instant boost' that goes away, this ludicrous power surge is maintained. I expect this is just a simple power conversion problem somewhere in the Induction Cables. Happens consistently across all quality levels of Induction Cables, from Copper to Silver to Iron. This should really be looked into as it basically means that you can power an entire base off a single ThermEx Steam Dynamo... just because you put 1 segment of Silver Induction Cable between it and your Energy Cube. Hope this helps, let me know if you need more testing and screenshots.

bug.title: Obsidian TNT detonation "invisible"
bug.body: http://puu.sh/5zLie.jpg

bug.title: Electric pump GUI bug
bug.body: Small bug, but make sure you round your stuff! http://puu.sh/5wIAl.jpg

bug.title: Energy Dupe with MFFS
bug.body: I'm not sure if this is your universal cable's problem or my machine's problem. As far as I know, I spent a quite long time figuring this out any it doesn't seem to be on my side. Infinite energy dupe. http://puu.sh/5wDD5.jpg The energy dupe does NOT happen when I change on the universal cables into conduits. http://puu.sh/5wDF4.jpg We can re-add in the RI wires to see if the RI wires will cause a dupe. If the RI wires don't cause a dupe bug, it might mean something's wrong with the universal cable.

bug.title: Resonant Furnace
bug.body: The ability of the furnace to create power has been taken away with the mekanism/resonant induction merge and I would really like to see it re added.

bug.title: Universal Cable crash
bug.body: I get this crash when I place universal cables: http://pastebin.com/F3S87Rv5

bug.title: No recipe for tesla coil.
bug.body: I noticed that I cannot craft a tesla coil. Are you aware of this and are you working on a fix?

bug.title: Failing builds
bug.body: Just want to let you know, all your latest builds on Jenkins failed.

bug.title: Non-vanilla liquids don't render in mechanical pipes
bug.body: Any liquid that isn't water or lava doesn't render when flowing through mechanical pipes. What's confusing to me is that every liquid I've tried (RailCraft creosote, AS steam and toxic waste, lots of MFR liquids) renders perfectly in a dynamic tank, and from a cursory glance at the pipes' and tanks' rendering code they don't seem to be handled differently. Any idea why this might be happening?
